alert.note: Alert for Pawnee; Rush; Stafford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 10:08PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pawnee, northern Stafford and southeastern Rush Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1008 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shaffer, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Pawnee, northern Stafford and southeastern Rush Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and central Kansas.
